# Generating List Items from Data

This sample shows you how to use `ng-repeat` to
generate items for a custom list component.

The component defines a `my-component` element
that creates a bulleted list.
The `ng-repeat` directive
creates a list item value every value in the
MyComponent class's `values` field.

    // file: index.dart
    @NgComponent(
        selector: 'my-component',
        publishAs: 'ctrl',
        template: '''<ul><li ng-repeat="value in ctrl.values">{{value.name}}</li></ul>'''
    )
    class MyComponent {
      List<Item> values = [new Item('1'), new Item('2'), new Item('3'), new Item('4')];

      MyComponent() {
        print('MyComponent');
      }
    }

All the HTML file has to do is insert the `my-component` element:

    // file: index.html
    <h3>A list component that generates its items from data using ng-repeat</h3>
    <my-component></my-component>

See also:
